at0000.1.description: *Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).(en)
Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).
Interacción, contacto o evento de cuidados entre un sujeto de cuidados y uno o más proveedores de cuidados de la salud.
*Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).(en)
Interação, contato ou cuidado entre o sujeito do cuidado e profissional(is) de saúde.
Interacción, contacto o evento de cuidado entre un paciente y un proveedor de salud.
Interactie, contact of zorggebeurtenis tussen een onderwerp van zorg en zorgverlener(s).
Interaktion, kontakt eller vårdhändelse mellan vårdtagare och vårdgivare inom hälso- och sjukvården.
Interaktion, Kontakt oder Versorgungsereignis, zwischen einem Versorgungsempfänger und einem Gesundheitsdienstleister.
Hoitohenkilön ja terveydenhuollon tarjoajan välinen vuorovaikutus, kontakti- tai hoitotapahtuma.
Interazione, contatto o evento di cura tra un soggetto di cura e il/i fornitore/i di assistenza sanitaria.
Interaction, contact ou événement de soins entre un sujet de soins et un ou des prestataires de soins.
Interaksjon, kontakt eller omsorgshendelse mellom et individ og helsepersonell.

de.purpose: Eine generische Abschnittsüberschrift eines Templates, welche entsprechend dem spezifischen klinischen Kontext umbenannt werden sollte.
de.use: Dieser Archetyp kann für die Erstellung einer Abschnittsüberschrift in einem Template verwendet werden. Die Überschrift kann, passend zu dem jeweiligen klinischen Kontext, umbenannt werden. Zum Beispiel: "Ad hoc Überschrift" wird umbenannt in "Untersuchungsergebnisse".
de.misuse: Die Überschrift sollte in einem Template nicht unverändert verwendet werden.

sv.purpose: En allmän avsnittsrubrik som döps om i en openEHR-mall för att passa in i en specifik klinisk kontext.
sv.use: Används för att skapa en avsnittsrubrik i en openEHR-mall som sedan döps om för att passa in i den specifika kliniska kontexten. Exempelvis "Rubrik" döps om till "Undersökningsfynd".
sv.misuse: Ska inte lämnas oförändrad i en openEHR-mall.

ru.purpose: Базовый заголовок раздела, должен быть переименован в локальном шаблоне
ru.use: используется для создания и именования разделов в локальных шаблонах
ru.misuse: *Not to be left unchanged in a template.(en)

nb.purpose: Brukes som en generisk seksjonsoverskrift som skal gis nytt navn i en templat for å passe i en gitt klinisk kontekst.
nb.use: Brukes til å lage en seksjonsoverskrift i en templat, hvis navn deretter endres for å passe i den aktuelle kliniske konteksten. For eksempel: "Templat-overskrift" endret til "Funn ved undersøkelse", "Anamnese", "Personopplysninger" eller "Oppsummering".
nb.misuse: Skal ikke stå med uendret navn i en templat.

es-ar.purpose: Proporcionar un encabezado de sección de tipo genérico que será renombrado en una plantilla para su empleo en un contexto clínico específico.
es-ar.use: Utilizar para construir un encabezado de sección en una plantilla y que será renombrado para su empleo en un contexto clínico específico. Por ejemplo, "Encabezado ad hoc" puede renombrarse como "Hallazgos de examen".
es-ar.misuse: No debe mantenerse sin cambios en una plantilla.

pt-br.purpose: Oferecer um cabeçalho de uma sessão genérica que será renomeado no template para adequar-se a um contexto clínico específico.
pt-br.use: Utilize para construir um cabeçalho de uma sessão (de um template) que será renomeada para adequar-se a um contexto clínico específico. Por exemplo: "cabeçalho Ad hoc" renomeado para "Achados de exame".
pt-br.misuse: Não deve manter a configuração original no template.

en.purpose: To provide a generic section header which will be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
en.use: Use to construct a section heading in a template that will be renamed to suit the specific clinical context. For example: "Ad hoc heading" renamed to "Examination findings".
en.misuse: Not to be left unchanged in a template.

sl.purpose: *To provide a generic section header which will be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.(en)
sl.use: *Use to construct a section heading in a template that will be renamed to suit the specific clinical context. For example: "Ad hoc heading" renamed to "Examination findings".(en)
sl.misuse: *Not to be left unchanged in a template.(en)

it.purpose: Fornire un'intestazione generica della sezione che sarà rinominata in un template per adattarsi ad uno specifico contesto clinico.
it.use: Usato per costruire un'intestazione di sezione in un template che sarà rinominato in base al contesto clinico specifico. Per esempio: "Intestazione ad hoc" rinominata in "Risultati dell'esame".
it.misuse: Non deve essere lasciato invariato in un template.

fr.purpose: *To provide a generic section header which will be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.(en)
fr.use: *Use to construct a section heading in a template that will be renamed to suit the specific clinical context. For example: "Ad hoc heading" renamed to "Examination findings".(en)
fr.misuse: *Not to be left unchanged in a template.(en)

at0000.1.description: A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Образец заголовка раздела
Un encabezado de sección de tipo genérico que será renombrado en una plantilla para su empleo en un contexto clínico específico.
Naslov sekcije
En generisk seksjonsoverskrift som skal gis nytt navn i en templat for å passe i en gitt klinisk kontekst.
Um cabeçalho de sessão genérico que deve ser renomeado no template para adequar-se a um contexto clínico específico.
En allmän avsnittsrubrik som döps om i en openEHR-mall för att passa in i en specifik klinisk kontext.
Eine generische Abschnittsüberschrift eines Templates, welche entsprechend dem spezifischen klinischen Kontext umbenannt werden sollte.
Un'intestazione di sezione generica che dovrebbe essere rinominata in un template per adattarsi ad uno specifico contesto clinico.
Un en-tête de section générique qui doit être renommé dans un modèle pour s'adapter à un contexte clinique spécifique.

author.name: Alan March
author.organisation: Hospital Universitario Austral, Buenos Aires, Argentina

author.name: Einar Fosse
author.organisation: Norwegian Centre for Integrated Care and Telemedicine, Tromsø, Norway

author.name: Vladimir Pizzo

de.purpose: Zur Darstellung der Ergebnisse einer bildgebenden Untersuchung einer bestimmten Körperstruktur oder -region und deren Interpretation mit radiologischen Verfahren.
keywords: Bild, Radiologie, Modalität, Röntgen, CT, Ultraschall, MRI, Diagnostik, Scan, Röntgenbild, X-Ray, Bildgebung, biomagnetisch, Densitometrie, Tomographie, Radiographie, magnetisch, Resonanz, Mammographie, Nuklear, Medizin, Positron, PET, Angiographie, Fluoroskopie
de.use:
Zur Darstellung der Ergebnisse einer bildgebenden Untersuchung einer bestimmten Körperstruktur oder -region und deren Interpretation mit radiologischen Verfahren.

Dieser Archetyp wurde entwickelt, mit dem Fokus auf die Befundung und Interpretation einer einzelnen bildgebenden Untersuchung (entspricht einer einzelnen DICOM-Studie). Verweise auf DICOM-bezogene Attribute sind enthalten, aber der Schwerpunkt liegt auf der Darstellung eines klinischen Berichts zu einer bildgebenden Untersuchung und nicht auf der Darstellung von DICOM-bezogenen Attributen, die in einem Radiologieinformationssystem (RIS) erwartet werden könnten. Spezifische Angaben über die DICOM-Serie können mithilfe von Archetyp CLUSTER.imaging_series dargestellt werden, der im SLOT „Seriendetails“ verschachtelt ist.

Detaillierte Befunde, die während einer bildgebenden Untersuchung beobachtet wurden und auf eine bestimmte Körperstruktur oder -region abzielen, können dargestellt werden, indem der Archetyp CLUSTER.imaging_exam und/oder seine Gruppe spezialisierter Archetypen innerhalb des SLOTs „Strukturierte bildgebende Befunde“ in diesem Archetyp verschachtelt werden. Es ist beabsichtigt, dass im Laufe der Zeit die spezifischen Informationen in jeder Spezialisierung erweitert werden, um Befunde mit allen bildgebenden Modalitäten einzubeziehen.

Wird eine bildgebende Untersuchung im Rahmen einer komplexeren Aktivität durchgeführt, wie z. B. eines interventionellen chirurgischen Eingriffs, sollte der bildgebende Befund mit diesem Archetyp erfasst werden.
Strukturierte Angaben über den chirurgischen Eingriff und verabreichte Medikamente oder Kontrastmittel sollten unter Verwendung der ACTION.procedure- bzw. ACTION.medication-Archetypen dargestellt werden. In dieser Situation wird empfohlen, alle verwandten Archetypen innerhalb derselben Templates zu repräsentieren.

Dieses Ergebnis wird dem anfordernden Kliniker normalerweise als eine Komponente im Kontext eines auf COMPOSITION-basierenden Gesamtberichts berichtet.
de.misuse:
Nicht zur Darstellung von Ergebnissen von körperlichen Untersuchung verwenden. Verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.exam und/oder seine Gruppe spezialisierter Archetypen.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um die Funktionalität oder Spezifikationen eines radiologischen Informations- oder Quellsystems zu replizieren.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um strukturierte Angaben zu einem durchgeführten Verfahren darzustellen. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck die spezifischen prozedurbezogenen Archetypen, wie z. B. den Archetyp ACTION.procedure.

Nicht zur Darstellung von strukturierten Anaben über Medikamente, die während des radiologischen Untersuchung verabreicht werden. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck spezifische medikamentenbezogene Archetypen, wie z. B. den Archetyp ACTION.medication.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um Fotos oder Videos in der Gesundheitsakte darzustellen. Verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.media_file.

sv.purpose: *To record the findings on imaging examination of a specified body structure or region and their interpretation, using radiological techniques. (en)
keywords: *image, radiology, modality, xray, CT, ultrasound, MRI, diagnostic, scan, x-ray, imaging, biomagnetic, densitometry, tomography, radiography, magnetic, resonance, mammography, nuclear, medicine, positron, PET, angiography, fluoroscopy (en)
sv.use:
*Use to record the findings on imaging examination of a specified body structure or region and their interpretation, using radiological techniques.

This archetype has been designed to focus on the reporting of findings and interpretation associated with a single imaging examination (equivalent to a single DICOM study). References to DICOM-related attributes are included but the focus is on the representation of a clinical report from an imaging examination and not on representing DICOM-related attributes that might be expected within a radiology information system. Specific details about the DICOM series can be recorded using the CLUSTER.imaging_series nested within the 'Series details' SLOT.

Detailed findings observed during an imaging examination and targeting a specified structure or region can be recorded by nesting the CLUSTER.imaging_exam and/or its family of specialised archetypes within the 'Structured imaging findings' SLOT in this archetype. It is intended that over time the specific detail in each specialisation will grow to include findings using all imaging modalities.

If an imaging examination is carried out as part of a more complex activity, such as a surgical operation carried out under imaging guidance, the imaging findings should be recorded using this archetype. 
Structured details about the surgical procedure and medications or contrast administered should be recorded using the ACTION.procedure and/or ACTION.medication archetypes, respectively. In this situation, it is recommended that all related archetypes should be reported within the same template.

This result will normally be reported back to the requesting clinician as one component within the context of an overall COMPOSITION-based report. (en)
sv.misuse:
*Not to be used to record findings on physical examination. Use the CLUSTER.exam and/or its family of specialised archetypes for this purpose.

Not to be used to replicate the functionality or specifications of a radiology information or source system.

Not to be used to record structured details about any procedure undertaken. Use the specific procedure-related archetypes, such as ACTION.procedure archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record structured details about medications administered during the imaging test. Use specific medication-related archetypes, such as the ACTION.medication archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record photographs or videos  within the health record. Use the CLUSTER.media_file archetype for this purpose. (en)

nb.purpose: For å registrere funn på og tolkning av bilder som er gjort ved radiologiske metoder på spesifikke strukturer eller regioner i kroppen.
nb.use:
Brukes for å registrere funn på og tolkning av bilder som er gjort ved radiologiske metoder på spesifikke strukturer eller regioner i kroppen.

Denne arketypen har blitt laget med fokus på svarrapportering av funn og tolkning en enkelt bildediagnostisk undersøkelse (tilsvarende en enkelt "DICOM Study"). Referanser til DICOM-relaterte attributter er inkludert, men fokuset er på representasjonen av en klinisk rapport fra en bildeundersøkelse og ikke på å representere DICOM-relaterte attributter som kan forventes i et radiologiinformasjonssystem (RIS/PACS). Spesifikke detaljer om DICOM-serien kan registreres ved å nøste arketypen CLUSTER.imaging_study_details i SLOT'et "Detaljer om undersøkelsesserier".

Detaljerte funn som er gjort ved en bildediagnostisk undersøkelse som er rettet mot en spesifikk struktur eller region i kroppen, kan registreres ved å nøste CLUSTER.imaging_exam (Bildediagnostisk undersøkelse - kroppsstruktur) eller en av de spesialiserte CLUSTER.imaging_exam arketypene i SLOT'et "Strukturerte funn" i denne arketypen. Det er tenkt at det over tid vil det bli utviklet slike spesialiseringer som hver for seg omhandler funn fra alle modaliteter.

Hvis den bildediagnostiske undersøkelsen er en del av en mer kompleks prosedyre, som en kirurgisk operasjon som utføres under bildeveiledning, skal de radiologiske funn og observasjoner bli registrert i denne arketypen. Strukturerte detaljer om den kirurgiske prosedyren og administrasjon av medikasjon eller kontrast bør registreres i henholdsvis ACTION.procedure (Prosedyre) og/eller ACTION.medication (Legemiddelhåndtering). I dette tilfelle anbefales det at alle relaterte arketyper, som detaljer om prosedyren eller administrasjon av medikasjon/kontrast bør samles i det samme templatet.

Svaret på bildediagnostikken vil normalt sett bli rapportert tilbake til den bestillende kliniker som en komponent innenfor rammen av en samlet COMPOSITION-basert rapport.
nb.misuse:
Skal ikke brukes til funn ved fysiske undersøkelser. Bruk CLUSTER.exam (Undersøkelsesfunn) eller dennes gruppe av spesialiserte arketyper for dette formålet.

Skal ikke brukes til å replikere funksjonaliteten til et radiologi informasjonssystem (RIS/PACS) eller kildesystem.

Skal ikke brukes til å registrere strukturerte detaljer om en klinisk prosedyre som er gjennomført. Bruk da de spesifikke arketypene for prosedyre-relatert innhold, for eksempel ACTION.procedure (Prosedyre).

Brukes ikke til å registrere informasjon om legemidlene som administreres under en bildediagnostisk undersøkelse. Bruk da de spesifikke legemiddelrelaterte arketypene, for eksempel ACTION.medication (Legemiddelhåndtering).

Skal ikke brukes til å lagre fotografier eller video i den elektroniske journalen. Bruk arketypen CLUSTER.media_file (Mediafil) for dette formålet.

en.purpose: To record the findings on imaging examination of a specified body structure or region and their interpretation, using radiological techniques.
keywords: image, radiology, modality, xray, CT, ultrasound, MRI, diagnostic, scan, x-ray, imaging, biomagnetic, densitometry, tomography, radiography, magnetic, resonance, mammography, nuclear, medicine, positron, PET, angiography, fluoroscopy
en.use:
Use to record the findings on imaging examination of a specified body structure or region and their interpretation, using radiological techniques.

This archetype has been designed to focus on the reporting of findings and interpretation associated with a single imaging examination (equivalent to a single DICOM study). References to DICOM-related attributes are included but the focus is on the representation of a clinical report from an imaging examination and not on representing DICOM-related attributes that might be expected within a radiology information system. Specific details about the DICOM series can be recorded using the CLUSTER.imaging_series nested within the 'Series details' SLOT.

Detailed findings observed during an imaging examination and targeting a specified structure or region can be recorded by nesting the CLUSTER.imaging_exam and/or its family of specialised archetypes within the 'Structured imaging findings' SLOT in this archetype. It is intended that over time the specific detail in each specialisation will grow to include findings using all imaging modalities.

If an imaging examination is carried out as part of a more complex activity, such as a surgical operation carried out under imaging guidance, the imaging findings should be recorded using this archetype. 
Structured details about the surgical procedure and medications or contrast administered should be recorded using the ACTION.procedure and/or ACTION.medication archetypes, respectively. In this situation, it is recommended that all related archetypes should be reported within the same template.

This result will normally be reported back to the requesting clinician as one component within the context of an overall COMPOSITION-based report.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record findings on physical examination. Use the CLUSTER.exam and/or its family of specialised archetypes for this purpose.

Not to be used to replicate the functionality or specifications of a radiology information or source system.

Not to be used to record structured details about any procedure undertaken. Use the specific procedure-related archetypes, such as ACTION.procedure archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record structured details about medications administered during the imaging test. Use specific medication-related archetypes, such as the ACTION.medication archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record photographs or videos  within the health record. Use the CLUSTER.media_file archetype for this purpose.

at0000.1.description: The result of an imaging examination performed on an individual, using radiological techniques.

at0020.1.description: Single word, phrase or brief description representing the likely condition or diagnosis.
at0020.1.comment: This data element has multiple occurrences to allow for more than one differential diagnosis. Coding with a terminology such as SNOMED CT is preferred, where possible. This data element should be considered as mutually exclusive to "Imaging differential diagnosis", ie only either "Imaging diagnosis" or "Imaging differential diagnosis" in each instance of the archetype "Imaging examination result." Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode in FHIR.

at0023.1.description: Additional narrative about the examination not captured in other fields.
at0023.1.comment: For example: a note that the film was given to the patient. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.note in FHIR.

at0004.1.description: The name of the imaging examination performed.
at0004.1.comment: For example: 'CT abdomen'; 'Doppler ultrasound of renal artery' or 'Plain chest xray'. Coding with a terminology is strongly recommended, preferably a term specifying both modality and anatomical location, where possible. Examples of candidate terminologies are the LOINC Imaging Document Codes, RadLex Playbook or SNOMED-CT. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.code in FHIR.

at0020.2.text: Kesimpulan hasil pemeriksaan, base base erection
at0020.2.description: Single word, phrase or brief description representing the likely condition or diagnosis.
at0020.2.comment: This data element has multiple occurrences to allow for more than one differential diagnosis. Coding with a terminology such as SNOMED CT is preferred, where possible. This data element should be considered as mutually exclusive to "Imaging differential diagnosis", ie only either "Imaging diagnosis" or "Imaging differential diagnosis" in each instance of the archetype "Imaging examination result." Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode in FHIR.

at0091.1.description: The type of imaging device, process or method that originally acquired or produced the data used to create the images in the study.
at0091.1.comment: For example: 'XRay', 'CT scan', 'ultrasound', 'MRI', 'bone densitometry', 'tomography', 'mammography', 'nuclear medicine', 'PET', 'angiography', and 'fluoroscopy'. This data element may be redundant if the modality is clearly represented in the 'Study name'. Alternatively it may also be possible to autopopulate the 'Modality' from a coded 'Study name'. Coding of the 'Modality' with a value set is recommended, such as the DICOM CID 29 Acquisition Modality value set. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.modality in FHIR and Modality (0008, 0060) in DICOM.

at0072.1.description: The status of the imaging examination result as a whole.
at0072.1.comment: The values have been aligned with the FHIR Diagnostic report status, with the exception of 'Entered in error' which is relevant only to a messaging-oriented paradigm. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'. In most use cases, only one status is applicable at any time, however this data element allows multiple occurrences for the use cases where there are a variety of types of status that need to be specified, usually within a template. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.status in FHIR.

at0072.2.text: Kesimpulan hasil pemeriksaan, base base erection
at0072.2.description: The status of the imaging examination result as a whole.
at0072.2.comment: The values have been aligned with the FHIR Diagnostic report status, with the exception of 'Entered in error' which is relevant only to a messaging-oriented paradigm. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'. In most use cases, only one status is applicable at any time, however this data element allows multiple occurrences for the use cases where there are a variety of types of status that need to be specified, usually within a template. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.status in FHIR.

at0020.2.description: Enkeltord, setning eller kort beskrivelse som uttrykker en den sannsynlige tilstand eller diagnose.
at0020.2.comment: Dette dataelementet er repeterbart for å tillate flere enn én diagnose. Det er anbefalt å bruke en terminologi dersom mulig, for eksempel SNOMED CT. Dette dataelementet bør oppfattes som gjensidig utelukkende til "Bildediagnostisk differensialdiagnose", altså bare enten "Bildediagnostisk diagnose" eller "Bildediagnostisk differensialdiagnose" i hver instans av arketypen "Bildediagnostisk svar". Tilsvarer DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode in FHIR.

at0072.2.description: Den overordnede statusen for hele undersøkelsesresultatet.
at0072.2.comment:
Verdisetettet her er samordnet med FHIR Diagnostic report status, med unntak av koden "Entered in error" som bare er relevant i et meldingsorientert paradigme. Andre lokale koder eller termer kan brukes ved å bruke datatypen "Fri eller kodet tekst". I de fleste tilfellene er det bare passende å bruke en statuskode. Dataelementet er imidlertid åpent for flere forekomster for å understøtte bruksområdene der statuser for forskjellige aspekter av resultatet er delt opp i flere elementer. Et eksempel på dette er de norske standard svarrapport av medisinske tjenester v1.4 (HIS 80822:2014), der status for undersøkelsesresultat (Tjenestetype) og status/steg i arbeidsflyt håndteres separat.

Dette elementet tilsvarer FHIR Diagnostic report status.

at0020.2.description: Ein einzelnes Wort, eine Phrase oder eine kurze Beschreibung, die einen wahrscheinlichen Zustand oder eine wahrscheinliche Diagnose darstellt.
at0020.2.comment: Dieses Datenelement kommt mehrfach vor, um mehr als eine Diagnose zu ermöglichen. Wenn möglich, wird eine Codierung mit einer Terminologie wie SNOMED CT bevorzugt. Dieses Datenelement ist als sich gegenseitig ausschließend zur „Bildgebenden Differenzialdiagnostik“ zu betrachten, dh jeweils nur entweder „Bildgebende Diagnostik“ oder „Bildgebende Differenzialdiagnostik“ des Archetyps „Bildgebendes Untersuchungsergebnis“. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode in FHIR.

at0072.2.description: Der Status des Ergebnisses der bildgebenden Untersuchung als Ganzes.
at0072.2.comment: Die Werte wurden mit dem Status von Diagnostic report im FHIR abgeglichen, mit Ausnahme von „Entered in error“, das nur für ein datenaustausch-orientiertes Paradigma relevant ist. Andere lokale Codes/Begriffe können über die "Choice of" vom Text-Datentyp verwendet werden. In den meisten Anwendungsfällen ist jeweils nur ein Status anwendbar, jedoch erlaubt dieses Datenelement mehrere Vorkommen für die Anwendungsfälle, in denen eine Vielzahl von Status-Typen angegeben werden müssen, normalerweise innerhalb eines Templates. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.status in FHIR.

at0020.2.description: Enstaka ord, fras eller kort beskrivning som representerar det troliga tillståndet eller diagnosen.
at0020.2.comment: *This data element has multiple occurrences to allow for more than one differential diagnosis. Coding with a terminology such as SNOMED CT is preferred, where possible. This data element should be considered as mutually exclusive to "Imaging differential diagnosis", ie only either "Imaging diagnosis" or "Imaging differential diagnosis" in each instance of the archetype "Imaging examination result." Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode in FHIR. (en)

at0072.2.description: *The status of the imaging examination result as a whole. (en)
at0072.2.comment: *The values have been aligned with the FHIR Diagnostic report status, with the exception of 'Entered in error' which is relevant only to a messaging-oriented paradigm. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'. In most use cases, only one status is applicable at any time, however this data element allows multiple occurrences for the use cases where there are a variety of types of status that need to be specified, usually within a template. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.status in FHIR.  (en)

de.purpose: Zur Darstellung der Ergebnisse einer bildgebenden Untersuchung einer bestimmten Körperstruktur oder -region und deren Interpretation mit radiologischen Verfahren.
keywords: Bild, Radiologie, Modalität, Röntgen, CT, Ultraschall, MRI, Diagnostik, Scan, Röntgenbild, X-Ray, Bildgebung, biomagnetisch, Densitometrie, Tomographie, Radiographie, magnetisch, Resonanz, Mammographie, Nuklear, Medizin, Positron, PET, Angiographie, Fluoroskopie
de.use:
Zur Darstellung der Ergebnisse einer bildgebenden Untersuchung einer bestimmten Körperstruktur oder -region und deren Interpretation mit radiologischen Verfahren.

Dieser Archetyp wurde entwickelt, mit dem Fokus auf die Befundung und Interpretation einer einzelnen bildgebenden Untersuchung (entspricht einer einzelnen DICOM-Studie). Verweise auf DICOM-bezogene Attribute sind enthalten, aber der Schwerpunkt liegt auf der Darstellung eines klinischen Berichts zu einer bildgebenden Untersuchung und nicht auf der Darstellung von DICOM-bezogenen Attributen, die in einem Radiologieinformationssystem (RIS) erwartet werden könnten. Spezifische Angaben über die DICOM-Serie können mithilfe von Archetyp CLUSTER.imaging_series dargestellt werden, der im SLOT „Seriendetails“ verschachtelt ist.

Detaillierte Befunde, die während einer bildgebenden Untersuchung beobachtet wurden und auf eine bestimmte Körperstruktur oder -region abzielen, können dargestellt werden, indem der Archetyp CLUSTER.imaging_exam und/oder seine Gruppe spezialisierter Archetypen innerhalb des SLOTs „Strukturierte bildgebende Befunde“ in diesem Archetyp verschachtelt werden. Es ist beabsichtigt, dass im Laufe der Zeit die spezifischen Informationen in jeder Spezialisierung erweitert werden, um Befunde mit allen bildgebenden Modalitäten einzubeziehen.

Wird eine bildgebende Untersuchung im Rahmen einer komplexeren Aktivität durchgeführt, wie z. B. eines interventionellen chirurgischen Eingriffs, sollte der bildgebende Befund mit diesem Archetyp erfasst werden.
Strukturierte Angaben über den chirurgischen Eingriff und verabreichte Medikamente oder Kontrastmittel sollten unter Verwendung der ACTION.procedure- bzw. ACTION.medication-Archetypen dargestellt werden. In dieser Situation wird empfohlen, alle verwandten Archetypen innerhalb derselben Templates zu repräsentieren.

Dieses Ergebnis wird dem anfordernden Kliniker normalerweise als eine Komponente im Kontext eines auf COMPOSITION-basierenden Gesamtberichts berichtet.
de.misuse:
Nicht zur Darstellung von Ergebnissen von körperlichen Untersuchung verwenden. Verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.exam und/oder seine Gruppe spezialisierter Archetypen.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um die Funktionalität oder Spezifikationen eines radiologischen Informations- oder Quellsystems zu replizieren.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um strukturierte Angaben zu einem durchgeführten Verfahren darzustellen. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck die spezifischen prozedurbezogenen Archetypen, wie z. B. den Archetyp ACTION.procedure.

Nicht zur Darstellung von strukturierten Anaben über Medikamente, die während des radiologischen Untersuchung verabreicht werden. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck spezifische medikamentenbezogene Archetypen, wie z. B. den Archetyp ACTION.medication.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um Fotos oder Videos in der Gesundheitsakte darzustellen. Verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.media_file.

sv.purpose: *To record the findings on imaging examination of a specified body structure or region and their interpretation, using radiological techniques. (en)
keywords: *image, radiology, modality, xray, CT, ultrasound, MRI, diagnostic, scan, x-ray, imaging, biomagnetic, densitometry, tomography, radiography, magnetic, resonance, mammography, nuclear, medicine, positron, PET, angiography, fluoroscopy (en)
sv.use:
*Use to record the findings on imaging examination of a specified body structure or region and their interpretation, using radiological techniques.

This archetype has been designed to focus on the reporting of findings and interpretation associated with a single imaging examination (equivalent to a single DICOM study). References to DICOM-related attributes are included but the focus is on the representation of a clinical report from an imaging examination and not on representing DICOM-related attributes that might be expected within a radiology information system. Specific details about the DICOM series can be recorded using the CLUSTER.imaging_series nested within the 'Series details' SLOT.

Detailed findings observed during an imaging examination and targeting a specified structure or region can be recorded by nesting the CLUSTER.imaging_exam and/or its family of specialised archetypes within the 'Structured imaging findings' SLOT in this archetype. It is intended that over time the specific detail in each specialisation will grow to include findings using all imaging modalities.

If an imaging examination is carried out as part of a more complex activity, such as a surgical operation carried out under imaging guidance, the imaging findings should be recorded using this archetype. 
Structured details about the surgical procedure and medications or contrast administered should be recorded using the ACTION.procedure and/or ACTION.medication archetypes, respectively. In this situation, it is recommended that all related archetypes should be reported within the same template.

This result will normally be reported back to the requesting clinician as one component within the context of an overall COMPOSITION-based report. (en)
sv.misuse:
*Not to be used to record findings on physical examination. Use the CLUSTER.exam and/or its family of specialised archetypes for this purpose.

Not to be used to replicate the functionality or specifications of a radiology information or source system.

Not to be used to record structured details about any procedure undertaken. Use the specific procedure-related archetypes, such as ACTION.procedure archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record structured details about medications administered during the imaging test. Use specific medication-related archetypes, such as the ACTION.medication archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record photographs or videos  within the health record. Use the CLUSTER.media_file archetype for this purpose. (en)

nb.purpose: For å registrere funn på og tolkning av bilder som er gjort ved radiologiske metoder på spesifikke strukturer eller regioner i kroppen.
nb.use:
Brukes for å registrere funn på og tolkning av bilder som er gjort ved radiologiske metoder på spesifikke strukturer eller regioner i kroppen.

Denne arketypen har blitt laget med fokus på svarrapportering av funn og tolkning en enkelt bildediagnostisk undersøkelse (tilsvarende en enkelt "DICOM Study"). Referanser til DICOM-relaterte attributter er inkludert, men fokuset er på representasjonen av en klinisk rapport fra en bildeundersøkelse og ikke på å representere DICOM-relaterte attributter som kan forventes i et radiologiinformasjonssystem (RIS/PACS). Spesifikke detaljer om DICOM-serien kan registreres ved å nøste arketypen CLUSTER.imaging_study_details i SLOT'et "Detaljer om undersøkelsesserier".

Detaljerte funn som er gjort ved en bildediagnostisk undersøkelse som er rettet mot en spesifikk struktur eller region i kroppen, kan registreres ved å nøste CLUSTER.imaging_exam (Bildediagnostisk undersøkelse - kroppsstruktur) eller en av de spesialiserte CLUSTER.imaging_exam arketypene i SLOT'et "Strukturerte funn" i denne arketypen. Det er tenkt at det over tid vil det bli utviklet slike spesialiseringer som hver for seg omhandler funn fra alle modaliteter.

Hvis den bildediagnostiske undersøkelsen er en del av en mer kompleks prosedyre, som en kirurgisk operasjon som utføres under bildeveiledning, skal de radiologiske funn og observasjoner bli registrert i denne arketypen. Strukturerte detaljer om den kirurgiske prosedyren og administrasjon av medikasjon eller kontrast bør registreres i henholdsvis ACTION.procedure (Prosedyre) og/eller ACTION.medication (Legemiddelhåndtering). I dette tilfelle anbefales det at alle relaterte arketyper, som detaljer om prosedyren eller administrasjon av medikasjon/kontrast bør samles i det samme templatet.

Svaret på bildediagnostikken vil normalt sett bli rapportert tilbake til den bestillende kliniker som en komponent innenfor rammen av en samlet COMPOSITION-basert rapport.
nb.misuse:
Skal ikke brukes til funn ved fysiske undersøkelser. Bruk CLUSTER.exam (Undersøkelsesfunn) eller dennes gruppe av spesialiserte arketyper for dette formålet.

Skal ikke brukes til å replikere funksjonaliteten til et radiologi informasjonssystem (RIS/PACS) eller kildesystem.

Skal ikke brukes til å registrere strukturerte detaljer om en klinisk prosedyre som er gjennomført. Bruk da de spesifikke arketypene for prosedyre-relatert innhold, for eksempel ACTION.procedure (Prosedyre).

Brukes ikke til å registrere informasjon om legemidlene som administreres under en bildediagnostisk undersøkelse. Bruk da de spesifikke legemiddelrelaterte arketypene, for eksempel ACTION.medication (Legemiddelhåndtering).

Skal ikke brukes til å lagre fotografier eller video i den elektroniske journalen. Bruk arketypen CLUSTER.media_file (Mediafil) for dette formålet.

en.purpose: To record the findings on imaging examination of a specified body structure or region and their interpretation, using radiological techniques.
keywords: image, radiology, modality, xray, CT, ultrasound, MRI, diagnostic, scan, x-ray, imaging, biomagnetic, densitometry, tomography, radiography, magnetic, resonance, mammography, nuclear, medicine, positron, PET, angiography, fluoroscopy
en.use:
Use to record the findings on imaging examination of a specified body structure or region and their interpretation, using radiological techniques.

This archetype has been designed to focus on the reporting of findings and interpretation associated with a single imaging examination (equivalent to a single DICOM study). References to DICOM-related attributes are included but the focus is on the representation of a clinical report from an imaging examination and not on representing DICOM-related attributes that might be expected within a radiology information system. Specific details about the DICOM series can be recorded using the CLUSTER.imaging_series nested within the 'Series details' SLOT.

Detailed findings observed during an imaging examination and targeting a specified structure or region can be recorded by nesting the CLUSTER.imaging_exam and/or its family of specialised archetypes within the 'Structured imaging findings' SLOT in this archetype. It is intended that over time the specific detail in each specialisation will grow to include findings using all imaging modalities.

If an imaging examination is carried out as part of a more complex activity, such as a surgical operation carried out under imaging guidance, the imaging findings should be recorded using this archetype. 
Structured details about the surgical procedure and medications or contrast administered should be recorded using the ACTION.procedure and/or ACTION.medication archetypes, respectively. In this situation, it is recommended that all related archetypes should be reported within the same template.

This result will normally be reported back to the requesting clinician as one component within the context of an overall COMPOSITION-based report.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record findings on physical examination. Use the CLUSTER.exam and/or its family of specialised archetypes for this purpose.

Not to be used to replicate the functionality or specifications of a radiology information or source system.

Not to be used to record structured details about any procedure undertaken. Use the specific procedure-related archetypes, such as ACTION.procedure archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record structured details about medications administered during the imaging test. Use specific medication-related archetypes, such as the ACTION.medication archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record photographs or videos  within the health record. Use the CLUSTER.media_file archetype for this purpose.

at0000.1.description: The result of an imaging examination performed on an individual, using radiological techniques.

at0091.1.description: The type of imaging device, process or method that originally acquired or produced the data used to create the images in the study.
at0091.1.comment: For example: 'XRay', 'CT scan', 'ultrasound', 'MRI', 'bone densitometry', 'tomography', 'mammography', 'nuclear medicine', 'PET', 'angiography', and 'fluoroscopy'. This data element may be redundant if the modality is clearly represented in the 'Study name'. Alternatively it may also be possible to autopopulate the 'Modality' from a coded 'Study name'. Coding of the 'Modality' with a value set is recommended, such as the DICOM CID 29 Acquisition Modality value set. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.modality in FHIR and Modality (0008, 0060) in DICOM.

at0020.1.description: Single word, phrase or brief description representing the likely condition or diagnosis.
at0020.1.comment: This data element has multiple occurrences to allow for more than one differential diagnosis. Coding with a terminology such as SNOMED CT is preferred, where possible. This data element should be considered as mutually exclusive to "Imaging differential diagnosis", ie only either "Imaging diagnosis" or "Imaging differential diagnosis" in each instance of the archetype "Imaging examination result." Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode in FHIR.

at0004.1.description: The name of the imaging examination performed.
at0004.1.comment: For example: 'CT abdomen'; 'Doppler ultrasound of renal artery' or 'Plain chest xray'. Coding with a terminology is strongly recommended, preferably a term specifying both modality and anatomical location, where possible. Examples of candidate terminologies are the LOINC Imaging Document Codes, RadLex Playbook or SNOMED-CT. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.code in FHIR.

at0072.1.description: The status of the imaging examination result as a whole.
at0072.1.comment: The values have been aligned with the FHIR Diagnostic report status, with the exception of 'Entered in error' which is relevant only to a messaging-oriented paradigm. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'. In most use cases, only one status is applicable at any time, however this data element allows multiple occurrences for the use cases where there are a variety of types of status that need to be specified, usually within a template. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.status in FHIR.

at0000.1.description: Resultatet av en bildediagnostisk undersøkelse av et individ, og som er gjort ved radiologiske metoder.
Ergebnis einer bildgebenden Untersuchung, die an einer Person mit radiologischen Verfahren durchgeführt wird.
*The result of an imaging examination performed on an individual, using radiological techniques. (en)

de.purpose: Zur Darstellung der Ergebnisse einer bildgebenden Untersuchung einer bestimmten Körperstruktur oder -region und deren Interpretation mit radiologischen Verfahren.
keywords: Bild, Radiologie, Modalität, Röntgen, CT, Ultraschall, MRI, Diagnostik, Scan, Röntgenbild, X-Ray, Bildgebung, biomagnetisch, Densitometrie, Tomographie, Radiographie, magnetisch, Resonanz, Mammographie, Nuklear, Medizin, Positron, PET, Angiographie, Fluoroskopie
de.use:
Zur Darstellung der Ergebnisse einer bildgebenden Untersuchung einer bestimmten Körperstruktur oder -region und deren Interpretation mit radiologischen Verfahren.

Dieser Archetyp wurde entwickelt, mit dem Fokus auf die Befundung und Interpretation einer einzelnen bildgebenden Untersuchung (entspricht einer einzelnen DICOM-Studie). Verweise auf DICOM-bezogene Attribute sind enthalten, aber der Schwerpunkt liegt auf der Darstellung eines klinischen Berichts zu einer bildgebenden Untersuchung und nicht auf der Darstellung von DICOM-bezogenen Attributen, die in einem Radiologieinformationssystem (RIS) erwartet werden könnten. Spezifische Angaben über die DICOM-Serie können mithilfe von Archetyp CLUSTER.imaging_series dargestellt werden, der im SLOT „Seriendetails“ verschachtelt ist.

Detaillierte Befunde, die während einer bildgebenden Untersuchung beobachtet wurden und auf eine bestimmte Körperstruktur oder -region abzielen, können dargestellt werden, indem der Archetyp CLUSTER.imaging_exam und/oder seine Gruppe spezialisierter Archetypen innerhalb des SLOTs „Strukturierte bildgebende Befunde“ in diesem Archetyp verschachtelt werden. Es ist beabsichtigt, dass im Laufe der Zeit die spezifischen Informationen in jeder Spezialisierung erweitert werden, um Befunde mit allen bildgebenden Modalitäten einzubeziehen.

Wird eine bildgebende Untersuchung im Rahmen einer komplexeren Aktivität durchgeführt, wie z. B. eines interventionellen chirurgischen Eingriffs, sollte der bildgebende Befund mit diesem Archetyp erfasst werden.
Strukturierte Angaben über den chirurgischen Eingriff und verabreichte Medikamente oder Kontrastmittel sollten unter Verwendung der ACTION.procedure- bzw. ACTION.medication-Archetypen dargestellt werden. In dieser Situation wird empfohlen, alle verwandten Archetypen innerhalb derselben Templates zu repräsentieren.

Dieses Ergebnis wird dem anfordernden Kliniker normalerweise als eine Komponente im Kontext eines auf COMPOSITION-basierenden Gesamtberichts berichtet.
de.misuse:
Nicht zur Darstellung von Ergebnissen von körperlichen Untersuchung verwenden. Verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.exam und/oder seine Gruppe spezialisierter Archetypen.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um die Funktionalität oder Spezifikationen eines radiologischen Informations- oder Quellsystems zu replizieren.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um strukturierte Angaben zu einem durchgeführten Verfahren darzustellen. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck die spezifischen prozedurbezogenen Archetypen, wie z. B. den Archetyp ACTION.procedure.

Nicht zur Darstellung von strukturierten Anaben über Medikamente, die während des radiologischen Untersuchung verabreicht werden. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck spezifische medikamentenbezogene Archetypen, wie z. B. den Archetyp ACTION.medication.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um Fotos oder Videos in der Gesundheitsakte darzustellen. Verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.media_file.

Detailed findings observed during an imaging examination and targeting a specified structure or region can be recorded by nesting the CLUSTER.imaging_exam and/or its family of specialised archetypes within the 'Structured imaging findings' SLOT in this archetype.
